creator: peter@pramberger.at
text:
I was a bit surprised when "openssl s_client" showed me a protocol version of TLSv1.2 when connecting to my freshly compiled Apache instance using OpenSSL 1.0.1. Somehow after reading the changelog of 2.4 it was my impression that there were additional server changes necessary...

Anyway, I don't know if a backport of the new OpenSSL features from 2.4 to 2.2 is planned or already in the pipe - if not, attached is a patch to control the new protocol version, as it is currently not possible to disable them if required.

Note that just the parts relevant for the config parser were taken from 2.4, no further functionality was backported.

Please check.
Sorry this did not receive any attention, similar code is now in 2.2.
creator: covener@gmail.com
